info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 12:28PM CDT until April 8 at 3:43AM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Cumberland River At Clarksville affecting Montgomery County.
For the Cumberland River...including Celina, OLD HICKORY DAM INFLOW FORECASTS, Penitentiary Branch, Carthage, Hunters Point, Edenwold, Hermitage, Pennington Bend, Omohundro Water Plant, Nashville, Bordeaux, Briley Pkwy At Cockrill Bend, Ashland City, Clarksville, Dover...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cumberland River at Clarksville.
* WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, Flooding continues to impact agricultural, industrial, and commercial properties, Riverfront Park, and adjacent tributaries including Bartons Creek, Red River, West Fork Red River, and Yellow Creek. Impacted locations include Riverside Dr near TN-48 and Providence Blvd, Quarry Rd, Kraft St near College St, Zinc Plant Rd, and properties near Salem Rd and Seven Mile Ferry Rd. Water approaches properties near Kraft St and Providence Blvd, and begins to cover Riverside Dr at Mc Clure St and near Cumberland Dr.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 47.6 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM CDT Saturday was 48.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 47.5 feet this afternoon. It will then rise to 47.7 feet this evening. It will fall to 47.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 48.4 feet early Monday morning. It will fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 46.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 630 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING
